chapters.title: Changes in Recording Voice
chapters.description: Lindy explains there will be noticeable changes in his voice due to the passage of time during the recording.

chapters.title: Moving to Canada at Eight
chapters.description: Lindy begins recounting a specific event: moving to Canada when he was eight years old.

chapters.title: Moving to Nebraska Farming
chapters.description: Lindy describes traveling to Nebraska to help a cousin with the harvest.

chapters.title: Janie's Baby's Death
chapters.description: Lindy mentions heading north and plans to cut back to a previous point in the narrative.

chapters.title: Avoiding a Power Company Job
chapters.description: Lindy describes traveling north and arriving in Minot, North Dakota, to look for work.; Lindy discusses his hesitation about a job at the power company due to lack of experience with high voltage.

chapters.title: Reviewing and Reorganizing Tapes
chapters.description: Lindy explains his process of reviewing and reorganizing tapes to ensure chronological order.

chapters.title: Acquiring a Diesel Plant
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing Jack Dyer's dissatisfaction with running the power plant and his financial situation.

chapters.title: Financial Agreement and Business Transition
chapters.description: Lindy explains informing the general manager about the deal with Jack Dyer and receiving approval from the company.

chapters.title: Jack Dyer's Business Troubles and Departure
chapters.description: Lindy shifts the conversation to Jack Dyer's subsequent venture in Winnipegosis, including obtaining a franchise and encountering difficulties.

chapters.title: Sudden Existential Reflection
chapters.description: Lindy abruptly shifts from discussing John Dyer to a confused, rambling internal monologue about his mental state and feeling like a 'thousand friends' and a 'loner'.

chapters.title: Early Career and Experience in Power Industry
chapters.description: Lindy begins to explain the history of his tapes, mentioning how they were used by children and sometimes erased.; Lindy discusses the challenges of managing men and the experience gained in the electrical business, specifically focusing on the importance of organization and leadership.

chapters.title: Military Truck Procurement
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing the procurement of military trucks, including the involvement of the Power Corporation and the acquisition of a gun carrier.; Lindy discusses the scarcity of materials after the war and the necessity of improvising, specifically mentioning the construction of a wooden derrick tripod.

chapters.title: Work After Dominion Electric
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to describing work done for the Power Commission in North Regina and subsequently in Saskatoon, including the conditions of working through frost.; Lindy describes a brief period of work in the town of Davidson for the old Dominion Electric Company.

chapters.title: Early Crew Management and Pole Setting
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to describing a unique problem encountered with stringing wire and his solution using hay pulleys.

chapters.title: Brian Mulroney Commentary
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing listening to Brian Mulroney talk about trade with the United States.

chapters.title: Kenora Job Details
chapters.description: Lindy begins detailing the specifics of the job running from Kenora to Priestville, including the need for a boring machine.

chapters.title: Sunday Work and Telephone Repair
chapters.description: Lindy describes the incident with the crew refusing to work on Sunday and the subsequent consequences.

chapters.title: Swift Current Job Start
chapters.description: Lindy describes starting a job north of Swift Current in June of 1948, building a line to Cypress Park from Maple Creek.

chapters.title: Yorkton to Melville Line
chapters.description: Lindy describes building a high voltage line from Kelliher to Yorkton and the challenges of snow delays.

chapters.title: Alberta Farm Work
chapters.description: Lindy describes his work building farms in Alberta around Lloydminster and Beggarville.

chapters.title: Ogama-Bangloff Viceroy Line
chapters.description: Lindy begins discussing a large project involving 300 miles of cross-arm line in the Ogama-Bangloff Viceroy area.

chapters.title: 1955 Work Project Details
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing the pricing structure established in 1950 or 1951.

chapters.title: 1961 Joint Bid
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing a joint bid with drags Johnson for a high voltage line project.

chapters.title: 1965 Swift College Project
chapters.description: Lindy transitions to discussing a large project at Swift College in 1965.

chapters.title: Company Ownership Shift
chapters.description: Lindy discusses the transfer of his company, LHA, to Art, Bill, George, and Vaughn, and the formation of Achen sixty-five Exercise ieuxProsperity Concerns Limited.

chapters.title: Retirement & Avoiding Burnout
chapters.description: Lindy reflects on his career and the impact of unions on the power industry.

chapters.title: Company History & Employees
chapters.description: Lindy reminisces about former employees and their experiences with the company.; Lindy discusses changes in ownership and shares within Achen Construction after his departure.

chapters.title: Career Progression - Lineman
chapters.description: Lindy discusses how he managed his employees and the importance of personal connection in a work environment.; Lindy begins to describe his career progression, starting with digging holes and working his way up to becoming a professional lineman.

chapters.title: Becoming a Journeyman Electrician
chapters.description: Lindy discusses his experience with inside wiring and obtaining his journeyman's paper.

chapters.title: Early Work Experience
chapters.description: Lindy begins recounting his early work experiences in Worthington, Iowa.

chapters.title: Working in Canada and Returning to Lower Wages
chapters.description: Lindy describes moving to Kenmer, North Dakota and the associated wage and room/board.

chapters.title: Incorporation and Wage Advice
chapters.description: Lindy discusses incorporating the company in 1953 and seeking advice from auditors about his wages.

summary: A personal memoir recording covering family memories and life stories.
